solveminmax.solver.get_lhs(equation)¶

Get the left-hand side of the equation.

Parameters

equation (str) – The string of the equation to be solved.

Returns

A string of the left-hand side of the equation.

Return type

str

solveminmax.solver.get_constants(equation)¶

Extract constants from the left-hand side of the equation.

Parameters

equation (str) – A string of the equation to be solved.

Returns

A list of constants on the LHS of the equation.

Return type

str

solveminmax.solver.get_minmax_terms(equation)¶

Get a list of minmax terms.

Parameters

equation (str) – A string of the equation to be solved.

Returns

A list of minmax_term objects.

Return type

list

solveminmax.solver.get_cons_var_terms(equation)¶

Get a list of cons_var_terms.

Parameters

equation (str) – A string of the equation to be solved.

Returns

A list of cons_var_term objects.

Return type

list

solveminmax.solver.find_set_points(minmax_terms, var_name)¶

Return a list of sorted set points.

Parameters

  • minmax_terms (list) – A list of minmax_term objects.

  • var_name (str) – A character, which is the name of the variable.

Returns

An empty list if there are variables but all coefficients are 0, such as min(30, 0*a), or if there are simply no variables, such as min(30, 30).

Return type

list

solveminmax.solver.create_intervals(set_points, low=0, high=1, left_open=True, right_open=True)¶

Create a list of intervals based on set_points.

Parameters

  • set_points (list) – A list of sorted set points.

  • low (float) – The lower bound of the variable.

  • high (float) – The higher bound of the variable.

  • left_open (bool) – True if the bound is open on the left.

  • right_open (bool) – True if the bound is open on the right.

Returns

A list of Interval objects based on set points.

Return type

list

solveminmax.solver.get_validate_eq(equation)¶

Return a modified equation string with = replaced by ==.

Parameters

equation (str) – The equation to be solved.

Returns

A modified equation string with = replaced by ==.

Return type

str

solveminmax.solver.random_interval(interval)¶

Generate a random number in the interval.

Parameters

( (interval) – object:Interval): An Interval object.

Returns

A random number generated uniformly from the interval.

Return type

float

solveminmax.solver.get_value_term(equation)¶

Get the value term on the right hand side of the equation.

Parameters

equation (str) – The equation to be solved.

Returns

The value term as a string.

Return type

str

solveminmax.solver.knit_solver(interval, minmax_terms, cons_var_terms, var_name)¶

Generate a string based on minmax_terms and cons_var_terms to be fed into the solver.

Parameters

  • ( (interval) – object:Interval): An Interval object.

  • minmax_terms (list) – A list of minmax_term objects.

  • cons_var_terms (list) – A list of cons_var_term objects.

  • var_name (str) – The character of the variable.

Returns

A knitted string of the equation.

Return type

str

solveminmax.solver.reformat_and_solve(knit, value_term)¶

Reformat the knit str to be compatible with sympy, then solve with solveset.

Parameters

  • knit (str) – The knitted equation string.

  • value_term (str) – The value term of the equation.

Returns

Solution after being solved by solveset.

solveminmax.solver.solve_linear_eq(cons_var_terms, value_term, low, high, left_open, right_open)¶

Solve a linear equation if the equation does not contain minmax_terms.

Parameters

  • cons_var_terms (list) – A list of cons_var_term objects.

  • value_term (str) – The value term of the equation.

  • low (float) – The lower bound of the variable.

  • high (float) – The upper bound of the variable.

  • left_open (bool) – True if the bound is open on the left.

  • right_open (bool) – True if the bound is open on the right.

Returns

Solution after being solved by solveset.

solveminmax.solver.extract_val_from_str(s)¶

Extract value from string.

Parameters

s (str) – A string that looks like “200*a”

Returns

The float from the string.

Return type

float

solveminmax.solver.minmax_replace_zeros(minmax_terms)¶

Replace minmax_terms where coefficients before variables are 0 to proper minmax_terms reformatted.

Parameters

minmax_terms (list) – A list of minmax_term objects.

Returns

None

solveminmax.solver.solve_no_minmax_var(minmax_terms, cons_var_terms, value_term)¶

Solve the equation when there are no variables in minmax_terms.

For example, when minmax_terms look like min(30, 30) or min(30, 0*a).

Parameters

  • minmax_terms (list) – A list of minmax_term objects.

  • cons_var_terms (list) – A list of cons_var_term objects.

  • value_term (str) – The value term.

Returns

Solution returned by solveset.

solveminmax.solver.get_next(result)¶

Get next item in the result set.

Parameters

( (result) – object:FiniteSet): The result returned by solveset.

Returns

The next item in result.

solveminmax.solver.get_next_eval(result)¶

Return the evaluate next item from result.

Parameters

( (result) – object:FiniteSet): The result returned by solveset.

Returns

The next item in result, evaluated by calling .evalf().

solveminmax.solver.find_intersect(interval, low, high, left_open, right_open)¶

Return the intersect of the interval with the required interval specified by low, high, left_open, and right_open.

Parameters

  • ( (interval) – object:Interval): An Interval object.

  • low (float) – The lower bound of the variable.

  • high (float) – The upper bound of the variable.

  • left_open (bool) – True if the bound is open on the left.

  • right_open (bool) – True if the bound is open on the right.

Returns

object:Interval: The intersection of the interval with required interval.

solveminmax.solver.append_interval_complexes(interval, eq, low, high, results)¶

Handle the case when the result is S.Complexes.

Parameters

  • ( (interval) – object:Interval): An Interval object.

  • eq (str) – The equation to be solved.

  • low (float) – The lower bound of the variable.

  • high (float) – The upper bound of the variable.

  • results (list) – The list of final results.

Returns

None

solveminmax.solver.append_interval_endpoints(interval, eq, result, results, low, high)¶

Handle the cases when result == interval.start or result == interval.end.

Parameters

  • ( (result) – object:Interval): An Interval object.

  • eq (str) – The equation to be solved.

  • ( – object:FiniteSet): The current result as FiniteSet object.

  • results (list) – The list of final results.

  • low (float) – The lower bound of the variable.

  • high (float) – The upper bound of the variable.

Returns

None

solveminmax.solver.process_results(results)¶

Process results depending on its length and return.

Parameters

results (list) – A list of final results.

Returns

The final result of the equation.

solveminmax.solver.auto_solve(eq, var_name, low=0, high=1, left_open=True, right_open=True)¶

Automatically solve the equation.

Parameters

  • eq (str) – The equation to be solved.

  • var_name (str) – The name of the variable. E.g. “a”.

  • low (float) – The lower bound of the variable.

  • high (float) – The upper bound of the variable.

  • left_open (bool) – True if the bound is open on the left.

  • right_open (bool) – True if the bound is open on the right.

Returns

The solution of the equation.
